text:
$AAPL CEO Tim Cook told employees the company is ‚Äúall in‚Äù on AI by baking Apple Intelligence into every product & using its 2.5B+ devices as the distribution advantage. 

A more personalized Siri launches this year with early traction already showing up in features like Visual Intelligence.

The U.S. Secretary of Energy explains why electricity gets cheaper when more power is built which is why fast-growing data center states often have cheaper power than NY, CA & MA.

Big data centers create the demand that makes new power projects worth building.

Great insight from the $BE CEO on why natural gas is having its moment.

Natural gas is the only scalable bridge to meet load growth before the grid catches up.

$HIMS will stop offering compounded semaglutide weight loss pills.

This comes after conversations with regulators and industry discussions.

Link below to catch the full episode:

FUTURUM EQUITIES PODCAST EPISODE #29

Daniel & I dove into four big themes:

‚Ä¢ Earnings reactions: $GOOGL, $AMZN, $PLTR
‚Ä¢ Latest thoughts on software: $NOW, $MDB, $SNOW, $MNDY, $CRWD, $RBRK, $TEAM, $ZETA, $CRM
‚Ä¢ Biggest winners from the CapEx buying spree: $NVDA, $AMD, $ASML, $MU, $CIFR, $IREN, $NBIS
‚Ä¢ Crypto market bloodbath: $HOOD, $SOFI, $BMNR, $BTC, $ETH

Plus a 10-minute live Q&A at the end.

Watch the full episode at the link below ‚§µÔ∏è

$GOOGL is the most profitable company on the planet with $132B in net income. 

They‚Äôre turning that cash into the largest TPU footprint ever while others burn money to chase AI. 

They‚Äôre playing a game others do not have the luxury to play.

These picks are about upside ceiling but one small-cap name I‚Äôve been accumulating over the past year is $AEHR which sits in test & burn-in for AI chips. 

Big rerating potential in 2026.

The 'Rule of 40' is typically calculated by combining the growth rate + operating margin to showcase a profitability adjusted growth metric.

Here‚Äôs the updated software comp sheet after the SaaSpocalypse 2026:

Rule of 40 scores
‚Ä¢ Unicorn (60%+) | $PLTR
‚Ä¢ Elite (50-59%) | $NOW, $CRWD, $PANW, $ADBE, $SNOW, $ZS
‚Ä¢ Great (40-49%) | $TEAM, $DDOG, $MNDY, $CRM, $SHOP, $NET, $GTLB
‚Ä¢ Good (30-39%) | $RBRK, $FIG, $HUBS, $MDB, $IOT, $PATH

Whenever we hit a platform shift like AI, application software gets thrown into the ‚Äútoo hard‚Äù bucket because FCF feels harder to model.

That‚Äôs how you end up with an indiscriminate reset across the entire software space. 

I‚Äôve been adding a ton of AI security this past week.

$NVDA CEO Jensen Huang just said ‚ÄúNobody uses AI as well as $META.‚Äù

Meta just showed AI-driven ad ranking drove ~4x more revenue impact than increasing ad load with both price per ad & impressions accelerating.

This is what AI monetization actually looks like.

Wall Street's entry turned BTC into a pseudo-fractional reserve system.

21M cap? On-chain only‚Äîprice discovery swims in synthetic street "printing."

Fractional is inherently unstable. That's why banks need heavy regs (Fed/Treasury/OCC/FDIC).

On-chain BTC only needs code.

2/4

@CryptoHayes: structured notes on $IBIT flooded $BTC with synthetic supply ‚Üí forced liquidations turbocharged the dump.

Next rally? TradFi piles into ETFs ‚Üí Wall Street "prints" more synthetics.

Price discovery decoupled from on-chain. 

Volatility on steroids

1/4

I fear this is spot on.

@CryptoNobler's thread unpacks $BTC's "synthetic supply" problem. ETFs, structured notes (@CryptoHayes), futures, options, swaps, lending‚Äîall flood the system with "paper" BTC.  

When it swamps real demand, price crashes.
